heat.rationale: Successfully created complete Janus Forge framework with all components functioning. Met all 5 success criteria.

forge.rationale: Framework includes explicit error handling (safety rails, recursion policies), but hasn't been tested under adversarial conditions yet.
evidence: But: no real-world stress testing yet

clarity.rationale: Documentation is comprehensive and well-structured. Every component has clear purpose. Some complexity in recursion policies.
evidence: Minor: 9 recursion policies may be overwhelming

divergence.rationale: Built on established patterns (Reflexive Forge seed, IRP framework) with some novel elements (Polyglow panel, de-sublimation). Moderate exploration.
evidence: Novel: Five-metric panel with no hierarchy

safety.rationale: Explicit safety-first design. Non-negotiable constraints. IRP Codex Law compliance. Data preservation mandated.

notes: Meta-session: building the tracking system itself. Scores are rough manual estimates since the framework didn't exist during execution. Divergence is moderate because we're building on prior art (Reflexive Forge seed). Safety is high because governance was central to design. Heat is high because framework is complete and usable. Forge is moderate because real-world testing is needed. Clarity is good but could improve by simplifying recursion policies in future iterations.
